website_summaries.verdict: The Free RN 2017 is recommended for runners who are looking for both cushioning and flexibility. Many users have been satisfied with the level of comfort and flexibility the shoe has provided. With its excellent durability, the shoe has met expectations of standing well to wear, even with daily use.
pros: Many users found the Free RN 2017 to be comfortable and lightweight
The shoe offers a running experience that is similar to running barefoot on grass, as commented by a reviewer
It provided a secure fit without constraining the foot, stated one runner
Several runners appreciated that the shoe was very easy to slip on or off
A lot of buyers mentioned that it is sleek and stylish at an affordable price
A majority of users was satisfied with the flexibility of the Free RN 2017 as they were able to run longer miles
cons: The lacing system was not very efficient as it came undone several times while running, a couple of runners observed
One user felt that the upper, particularly the apparently narrow toe box and flimsy lacing system, is an area that needs improvement

customer_reviews.title: They are extremely comfortable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I wear these trainers to the gym. They are extremely comfortable and lightweight. I use them for treadmill running and various floor work and lifting weights. They are a very versatile trainer and provide stability and comfort in all activities I engage in in the gym. They look smart too and I have been asked by numerous people where I purchased them and the cost etc.
customer_reviews.author: Zak the Dog

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe but be careful with the sizing.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and very light weight. However, be careful with the sizing. I’m an EU size 44, which is a 9 by the size chart. I bought a 10.5 since others reported the tight fit and this size fits me just right. I’m not sure why the disparity and if the sizing is done with the assumption that you’ll be wearing the shoe barefooted and if the material stretches considerably over time.
customer_reviews.author: MacLink

customer_reviews.title: ... little tighter than the originals but they get more comfortable after a couple of wears
customer_reviews.text: These 2017 versions come a little tighter than the originals but they get more comfortable after a couple of wears. They're also thinner/more ventilated at the front so you feel the cold more, which can be positive or negative depending on time of year. They look a little slicker than the originals but IMO, the originals are slightly more comfortable overall/
customer_reviews.author: O. Morad

customer_reviews.title: Stylish Park Run trainer
customer_reviews.text: A nice looking trainer - well made and comfortable, so perfect for my Park Run and occasional 5-10k runs. They have less impact cushioning than many trainers and are part of the 'free running/barefoot trend' so I wouldn't want to do serious distances in them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr S Glover

customer_reviews.title: Go half a size up :-)
customer_reviews.text: I had these in a size 7, (I am a 7) and was really happy with them, the only thing was my feet always felt slightly tight (when running your feet actually do expand!). So I purchased a 7.5 and now i’m even more happy and comfortable and if they ever wear out (they havent after 30+ runs) I will get these again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D. Humphreys

customer_reviews.title: Nike Free Rn 2017
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for replacements for my Free 5.0s and these fit the bill perfectly. Great price too. I've said the shoes fit is as expected but thats only because I've had similar before. They tend to be slightly small so I would always go a 1/2 size up from other makes. Plenty of toe box room and extremely comfortable straight from the box. I could wear these all day every day. Great if you have a job in which you need your feet to be comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Flooj12

customer_reviews.title: Fits well
customer_reviews.text: Bought a size 7, looks nice and is comfortable. Not taken them out for a long run, I just use these shoes to travel to and from work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Super fast delivery. Lovely trainers and just what I was after. Couldn't believe the price either! Fit is very small though. I have other Nike trainers in a 9 that feel just right, so ordered the same size, but these ones hurt my feet as they are so small! I know that's Nike's inconsistency not the retailer. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: A butler

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable running shoes. Colour allows trainers to be worn more formally
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy / work the calf , leg muscles
customer_reviews.text: Perfect if you want to work your calf/ leg muscles even outside the gym I like the discreet Nike logo Cool trainers
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: nice pair of runners, standard nike sizing, feel good as soon as you put them on
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get yourself a present !
customer_reviews.text: Get youself a present and buy a pair of those extremele comfy and fit with all styles nike shoes . Just buy them half size larger ( for me I usually wear a 9.5 UK , this time I did a 10 Uk and they fit amazingly !
customer_reviews.author: Georgios Tsachlis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love them, I'm going to buy another pair very soon
customer_reviews.author: Valentina C.

customer_reviews.title: 5Star
customer_reviews.text: They are extremely comfortable. Thank you for the fast delivery
customer_reviews.author: نوا يوسف

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: My second pair and they feel exactly like the ones I bought a year ago. Excellent shoes for smooth surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Goran Herbert Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great products
customer_reviews.text: Great range of trainers to buy, love the nike run and flex range, very durable, last pair lasted 5 years, delivered as expected, good packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Pretty comfortable for shorter runs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to just get back into running again. I go mainly on pavements and they're pretty good. Good cushioning and feel pretty light.
customer_reviews.author: Cambo

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: Started running in thesevin 2017 and would find it hard to switch - so lightweight and comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: fake
customer_reviews.text: blatant fakes will be returning in the morning, stitching is visible and sloppy
customer_reviews.author: l.d

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for - great fit, love the style and super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: LJ Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy - great for running
customer_reviews.text: I have two pairs of these. One pair I use on the treadmill. One pair for table tennis. Very comfy shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. D. Latham

product_meta.title: Nike Men's Free Rn 2017 Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Designed for shorts runs, the Nike FREE RN 2017 men's running shoe is the most easy-going of the free family. The innovative sole lets your foot flex and expand naturally. They're easy to pack in a tote or backpack and have a simple style that fits in with an everyday outfit—so you could get in a few unplanned miles.
feature_bullets: Mesh upper for maximum comfort and breathability.
